Field.tooltip: select an exsting plot or choose NEW
Field.Label: 1...Name of the Plot here...............

Field.tooltip: this will store the new plot name
Field.Label: confirm NEW Name
Field.Title: CONFIRM

Field.tooltip: Select type of line to be plotted
Field.Label: 3...DEFINE the LINE ............... Type

List.Option: Dot .
Dot +
Dot x
Dot *
Dot o
Dot v
Dot ^
Dot Solid Square
LineSolid
LineDashed
Histogram
Histogram empty
Histogram pattern x
Histogram pattern xx(GNU) *(MAT) plot
Histogram pattern \
Histogram pattern /
Filled (transparent) Curves

Field.tooltip: Select width of line to be plotted
Field.Label: ... Width

Field.tooltip: Select color of line
Field.Label: ... Color

light-red
dark-red
light-yellow
dark-yellow
light-green
dark-green

dark-green-blue
light-blue
dark-blue

dark-indigo
black
dark-grey
light-grey
white

Field.defaultValue: The text that goes on top of the Plot
Field.Label: 4...Other parameters..........Title Text

Field.tooltip: Select the font size in points
Field.Label: Font Size pts:

List.Option: default

Field.tooltip: Select color of text and frame in plot

Field.Label: Plot size

large (1024x768)

Field.tooltip: This will CREATE the device/state/text/color you selected
Field.Label: 5...click to create plot file................
Field.Title: CREATE

Field.Label: it will tell INDIGOplotD to create the plot in your plot directory/

Field.tooltip: This will show the plot on your screen
Field.Label: 6...click to show plot.......................
Field.Title: SHOW

MenuItem.Name: Define / select data sources, needed in PLOTS

Field.Label: 1. pick Device or Variable data to be used (tracked) for plotting :
Expert Mode ON / OFF:
Field.Description: if you want to set ADVANCED parameters

Field.Label: 1.1 Select Device or Variable to be tracked.................

Field.tooltip: you have to click on your choice to signal your entry
Field.Label: Select existing or new Device/Variable:

Field.tooltip: This will delete the device after confirm
Field.Label: to Delete checkbox
Field.Title: DELETE

Field.tooltip: This will confirm the device you selected for state/properties selection
Field.Label: After selection click
Field.Title: CONFIRM

Field.Label: 1.2 Select States of Device/Variable to be tracked.

Field.tooltip: Select the MEASUREMENT you like to perform on the device/state (or what kind of data is this):
Field.Label: ..measurement:

List.Option: delete this state from selection list
Events-UP, raw data, no averages, read SQL-logger, only when State is changed to UP/TRUE/1/ON
Events-CHANGE, raw data, no averages, read SQL-logger, only when State is changed
Events-ANY, raw data, no averages, read SQL-logger, when State is updated - any entry
Events-DOWN, raw data, no averages, read SQL-logger, only when State is changed to DOWN/FALSE/OFF/0
Events-COUNT, raw data, count in bin range, read SQL-logger, only when State is UP/TRUE/1/ON, please set RESET period
Direction 0 to 360 0 at East counter clock increase (math convention)
Direction 0 to 360 0 at North clock wise increase (like compass)
Direction 0 to 2pi 0 at East counter clock increase (math convention)
Direction 0 to 2pi 0 at North clock wise increase (like compass)
Electric Consumption (Cost)
Gas Consumption (Cost)
Water Consumption (Cost)
Other Consumption (Cost)
Delta: Value of this timeBin - Value of previous timeBin: Delta= (averageValue(n)-averageValue(n-1))
DeltaNormHour(of Bin n)= (FirstMeas(n+1)-LastMeas(n-1))/(FirstSeconds(n+1)-LastSeconds(n-1))*3600 (=seconds in 1 Hour)==> useFor Energy-->Power
Integral over time ie: I= Measurement(n)*deltaTime + I(n-1) eg Power = V*A or Watt --> Energy= Watt*Hour
first data in time bin
last data in time bin
max
min
count
sum
average

Field.tooltip: Select the the RESET frequency for the consumption or integration . FOR CONSUMPTION ONLY: The details (period timing ) and applied Cost are defined in the COST section below:
Field.Label: ..reset:

List.Option: reset each Day, variable Cost for Consumption only
reset each Week, variable Cost for Consumption only
reset each Month, variable Cost for Consumption only
reset each Year, variable Cost for Consumption only
reset each Period, variable Cost for Consumption only
reset each Period, cost=1 for Consumption only
reset each Day, cost=1 for Consumption and Integration
reset each Week, cost=1 for Consumption and Integration
reset each Month, cost=1 for Consumption and Integration
reset each Year, cost=1 for Consumption and Integration

Field.Label: use format YYYY/MM/DD/HH+Y/M/D/H+Y/M/+... enter up to 30:

Field.tooltip: fillGap =no: if there is no data in the time-bin, no value is extrapolated, fillGap=yes: if there is no data in the time bin the value from the last time bin us used.
Field.Label: Fill data gaps

List.Option: do not fill data gaps if no information in Time bin
fill data gaps with last available info if no information in Time bin
delete this state from selection list

Field.tooltip: This will store the properties for this device
Field.Label: After selecting properties click..........................:
Field.Title: CONFIRM

MenuItem.Name: WRITE file paths and name of PLOT.png files to logfile for use in Control Pages
Re-load Data from SQL Database for last 2 days
Print/Log States of all devices and variables and eligibilty to plot
Print FORMATTED source data to /Library/Application Support/Perceptive Automation/Indigo 7.x/Preferences/Plugins/com.karlwachs.INDIGOplotD/data/xxx.dat.formatted

Field.Label: after clicking EXECUTE you MIGHT get a timeout as the restore process could take longer than 10 secs(time limit by indigo for waiting to come back to the display) for a large config. That is not a problem

MenuItem.Name: DELETE DEVICE/VARIABLE configuration data = RESET to start from scratch !!

Field.Label: after clicking EXECUTE you MIGHT get a timeout as the delete process could take longer than 10 secs(time limit by indigo for waiting to come back to the display) for a large config. That is not a problem
click on execute to reset all device data
Field.Title: EXECUTE
